abstract: Justice Dept charges Cherno Njie and Papa Faal, two American citizens of Gambian descent, for conspiring to violate Neutrality Act by aiding people behind failed coup attempt to depose Gambian Pres Yahya Jammeh; department had invoked seldom-used law, which prohibits Americans from fighting against nations at peace with the US, in effort to reach those believed to have helped the plotters.
lead_paragraph: The two were accused in federal court of conspiracy to violate the Neutrality Act in connection with a botched attempt to depose the Gambian president.

byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington.

snippet: The two were accused in federal court of conspiracy to violate the Neutrality Act in connection with a botched attempt to depose the Gambian president.

keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
keywords.name: subject

headline.main: Two in U.S. Face Charges After Coup Attempt Fails in Gambia
headline.print_headline: Two in U.S. Face Charges After Coup Fails in Gambia
